body.p:
Richmond Ky.
Sep 25. 1865.
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky.

I am Captain of Company in the Regt. Ky National Legion -- my Company was raised in this county (Madison) but the men live partly in this County -- partly in Estill -- partly in Jackson & partly in Rockcastle. -- and of course are very much scattered when permitted to dispense & go at large. -- they could not be assembled upon an emergency under a week or ten days time -- Troops have been kept here pretty much all the time & are necessary, but there are none here now. -- but a company of troops straggling about through the country as mine are, are not only of no benifit but are a nuisance -- I served over three years in Wolfords Regt. & know well the influence of allowing men to straggle & roam without control

I respectfully request your Excellency to issue such orderes as will authorize me to assemble my men, go into camp at or near Richmond, and thus enable me to keep them together as a body -- otherwise I repeat the organization is worse than useless

I have the honor to be
Very respectfully
W. P. Ballard
Capt.
We concur fully in the within views & request of Capt. Ballard.

Thos Rowland
Late Maj 1st Ky Cavl
Jas M Kindred Late Lieut S R Q M
8th Ky I V now S M C
David Russell Late Capt 21st Ky Infty
W C Goodloe
P. P. Ballard

72
Richmond Ky
Sept 25th 1865
Ballard W. P
Capt.
To Gov
Say he has a Co of the National Legion in Madison Co: And they are inefficient in their present condition. Requests an order to assemble his company and go into Camp at Richmond.

LB No 17 - 1865 P160
Recd A G O Ky 28 Sep 1865.

Hd Qrs Ky Volunteers
Adjt Genls Office
Frankfort Ky
Sept 28" 1865
Respectfully referred to Maj W H Hays Insp Gen Ky.

D W Lindsey
Adj Genl Ky
Ans. Sep. 29/65. Lt. Bk B. pp. 290-91
Rec. I. G. O. Sep 29, 1865.
